definition: to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)

sentences.english: But she found material were missing in a newspaper report the loss of STH proof.
sentences.chinese: 可她發現資料裏少了一份登報掛失證明。

sentences.english: Put a wedding announcement in the newspaper.
Even a haircut was enough to get Nyiregyhazi into the papers.
sentences.chinese: 甚至連剪個發都足以讓尼萊吉哈奇登報。

sentences.english: The post was advertised in today's newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 那個職位今天登報招聘。

sentences.english: He broke off his engagement to her.
sentences.chinese: 他們訂婚的消息登報了。

sentences.english: They announced the date of their wedding in the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他們登報宣佈了他們婚期。

definition: to be transferred to another post/to post away
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to bear joint responsibility for sth/joint liability (law)
Huwei town in Yunlin county 雲林縣|云林县[Yun2 lin2 xian4], Taiwan
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
